humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report states that 'seven of eleven examined lymph nodes with metastatic carcinoma' were found in the left breast and axillary contents. This indicates that the patient has metastases in 4 to 9 axillary lymph nodes, which corresponds to N2a according to the AJCC staging system (New Rule 14 and New Rule 15).

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The patient has metastatic carcinoma in 7 out of 11 examined lymph nodes, with extracapsular extension and the largest deposit being 1.8 cm. According to the AJCC classification provided in the report, this corresponds to a pN2a (i+) stage. I have ignored any substaging information as requested.
